title: Unable to find ConfigSourceFactory provider after upgrading to Quarkus 2.13.3
body:
### Describe the bug

**Summary**:
* After upgrading to Quarkus 2.13.3, using the ConfigSourceFactory from SmallRye no longer seems to work when the `apicurio-registry-avro` extension is present. The build is successful when changing the Quarkus version to 2.13.2 or below. 
* I noticed that changes in this area were made in the latest release: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/28538

### Expected behavior

The build is successful.

### Actual behavior

The build is unsuccessful and fails with the following stacktrace.

**Stacktrace**
```
* Exception is:

```

### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a Quarkus project with the `apicurio-registry-avro` extension: `quarkus create app org.acme:build-issue --extension='apicurio-registry-avro' --gradle`
2. Add a ConfigSourceFactory following the Quarkus docs: https://quarkus.io/guides/config-extending-support#config-source-factory
3. Build the project `./gradlew clean build`
4. Stacktrace attached is produced

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin MacBook-Pro.local 21.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.6.0: Mon Aug 22 20:17:10 PDT 2022; root:xnu-8020.140.49~2/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

java 11.0.11 2021-04-20 LTS

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.13.3.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Gradle 7.4.2

### Additional information

_No response_
